items.q: When Frida Kahlo was a child, she already demonstrated ____. a. a rebellious spirit b. a calm personality c. an interest in painting d. an interest in photography
When Frida Kahlo was six years old, she stayed in bed for six months because she had ____. a. the flu b. a broken leg c. polio d. a car accident
Frida Kahlo ____ her physical disability by becoming more outgoing. a. depicted b. demonstrated c. thrived on d. compensated for
Because Frida Kahlo sympathized with the ideals of the Mexican Revolution, she adopted a very ____ new style for herself. a. restrained b. radical c. conventional d. turbulent
Frida Kahlo's famous school group, the Cachuchas , demonstrated a clear ____ for authority. a. contempt b. turbulence c. self-assurance d. impact

When Frida Kahlo was returning from school one day, the trolley she was on hit a bus and she became disabled by the impact. The word impact means ____. a. collision b. restraint c. failure d. turbulence

While Frida Kahlo attended the National Preparatory School in Mexico City, Mexico was experiencing ____. a. an economic depression b. a lack of food c. a strong nationalism d. a political dictatorship
Before her terrible trolley accident, Frida Kahlo planned to ____. a. study painting b. become a photographer c. become a doctor d. go into politics
Frida Kahlo's paintings usually depicted ____. a. her love for Diego Rivera b. the daily pain she suffered c. her close family connections d. her love of nature
The marriage of Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera was a very turbulent. The word turbulent means ____. a. calm b. romantic c. stormy d. depressing

The three parts of an essay are ____. a. the conclusion, the summary, and the introduction b. the introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion c. the introduction, body paragraphs, and the thesis statement d. the thesis statement, the introduction, and the conclusion
The body paragraphs support ____. a. the title b. the conclusion c. the introduction d. the thesis statement
The contents of an introduction develop from ____. a. a general statement to a specific example b. cause to effect c. general to specific d. specific to general
The concluding paragraph does not contain ____. a. a summary b. a comment on the topic c. new information d. a restatement of the thesis statement
A mural is ____. a. a postage-size painting in public parks b. a large painting in or on a public building c. a new form of photography d. a new form of architecture
Mexican muralists of the early twentieth century were influenced by ____. a. a new European love poetry b. ancient Greek architecture c. the Mexican Revolution d. the development of photography
If something is on the verge of happening, it _____. a. happened a long time ago b. happened a little while ago c. will happen very soon d. will never happen
If a city is geared up for a celebration, it _____. a. is completely ready for it b. is beginning to plan it c. is worried about problems with it d. is happy that it is over
A nightmare is something that _____. a. most people expect to happen b. causes problems for people c. happens very slowly d. never actually happens

If a volleyball player surpasses her earlier record, she _____. a. doesn’t do as well as in the past b. tells everyone about her new record c. plays better than she has in the past d. talks about her earlier record
A loner is someone who _____. a. lets people borrow money b. doesn’t seem to need other people c. feels lonely all the time d. often borrows money from other people
Bilbao is located in _____ Spain. a. northern b. southern c. eastern d. western
In the past, Bilbao was famous for its _____. a. fine artists b. many farms c. tall buildings d. many industries
Which country did not have an architect who submitted a plan for the new museum? a. the U.S. b. Spain c. Austria d. Japan
The new museum was built by _____. a. the Spanish government b. a group called CATIA c. the Guggenheim Foundation d. Spanish artists
Gehry’s early family life was always _____. a. calm b. changing c. terrible d. boring
Which noun does not belong after the adjective cultural ? a. history b. life c. boom d. math
Which noun does not belong after the adjective rectangular ? a. room b. paper c. idea d. object
Which adjective does not belong before the noun design ? a. unusual b. surprising c. slow d. boring
The purpose of an essay introduction is to introduce the topic and present the conclusion.
A good way to get the reader's attention is to begin an introduction with an anecdote.
A thesis statement must be expressed as a complete sentence.
Body paragraphs do not need to follow a logical order.
Frida Kahlo's father was an English professor in Mexico City.
One meaning of the word soar is fly .
A disintegrating building is usually one that is very old.
Businesses make a lot of money in an economic boom .
If something has an impact on you, you don’t notice it.
If you eliminate a pain, you feel it strongly.
Gehry also built the Guggenheim Museum in New York City.
Bilbao is a small city.
CATIA is the name of a computer program used by Gehry.
The Bilbao museum is covered in metal.
All the rooms in the Bilbao museum have curving walls.
The adjective radical can be used to describe design.
The adjective wavy can be used to describe the motion of a river.
What device is used to get the reader's attention?
What is the thesis statement?
Write a conclusion for a biographical essay with this introduction.
Write an essay about a well-known artist or musician.
